text: Preparing the dry masala powder Dry roast all the dry masala ingredients together with the cinnamon and dry red chillies.  Cook till the fragrance is evident. Remove from the heat. Powder the heated spices in a hand grinder. Set aside briefly. Cooking the dish Heat oil in a deep pan or cooker. Add the jeera. After it crackles, add onion and fry till translucent. Add the garlic and tomatoes. Fry for 4 to 5 minutes, till soft. Add the soaked dal with turmeric powder, salt and 4 cups of water  Add ginger paste and coconut. Cover the lid and let it cook till the dal is half cooked. Add the cut vegetables as well. Cook till the vegetables are tender. Combine with the dry masala powder. Once dal and vegetables are done, add the dry masala powder and mix it nicely. Add lemon juice and mix through. This is an optional addition. Serve. Garnish the finished dish with coriander leaves and serve hot over brown/white/steamed rice.
